meanings.definition: The lowest part of a ship's hull, where water collects.
meanings.sent1: The sailors worked hard to pump out the bilges and keep the ship afloat.
meanings.sent2: The crew inspected the bilges regularly to prevent any water damage.
meanings.sent3: When the bilges overflowed, it looked like a small indoor swimming pool!
meanings.sent4: The bilges of the ship were like the basement of a house, always damp and musty.
meanings.sent5: The dark, cramped bilges were the least favorite part of the ship for the crew.

meanings.definition: To fill with water and sink.
meanings.sent1: If we don't fix the leak, the boat will bilges and we'll be in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden boat bilges easily if it's not properly maintained.
meanings.sent3: The kids thought it would be funny to bilges their toy boat in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain caused the river to bilges and flood the nearby fields.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the cargo caused the small boat to bilges and capsize in the storm.

meanings.sent1: The balloon bilges as more air is blown into it.
meanings.sent2: His backpack started to bilges with all the books he was carrying.
meanings.sent3: The tire began to bilges after hitting a sharp rock on the road.
meanings.sent4: The pastry dough will bilges slightly as it bakes in the oven.
meanings.sent5: The balloon animal's tail bilges out in a funny shape.
